channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CA

item.title: Report X-2023120813
item.description:
Report X-2023120813

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-05T18:16:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-01
  • City: SAN DIEGO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: AT THE MOMENT THE PCKAGE HANDLER TRIED TO PLACE THE PACKAGE IN THE BELT HE ACCIDENTALLY DROPPED IT. DescribePack: THERE WAS NOT ENOUGH INNER PACKAGING TO SUPPORT A FALL DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A HAZMAT TOTE INSIDE A BAG TO PREVENT SPILLING AND IT WAS PROSSECED ACCORDINGLY TO THE DISPOSITION

item.title: Report X-2023121153
item.description:
Report X-2023121153

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-15
  • City: SAN DIEGO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO THE PRELOAD TO A REPORT OF A PACKAGE HAVING A STRONG SMELL. UPON DISCOVERING THE PACKAGE W/HAZARDOUS MATERIAL SHIPPING PAPERS AND DISPLAYING AN OXIDIZER 5.1 DIAMOND HAZARD LABEL, RESPONDER DONNED THE APPROPIATE PPE AS OUTLINED IN THE DECISION TREE RESPONSE BOOKLET.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Top of pail appeared wet on lid, also leaking on label that was on lid DescribePack: Fluid was leaking through the cap. Cap was tight and did not move, but fluid was still coming through the cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Pail was taken and isolated and placed in hazmat storage cage.

DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was picked up and brought to the HMPA for further processing.

item.title: Report X-2023120808
item.description:
Report X-2023120808

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-05T18:16:01+00:00

  • City: SAN DIEGO

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: When it was discovered that the package was leaking liquid, it was removed from the conveyor belt and placed in a Hazmat tote so it could be inspected. DescribePack: The package was damaged because when it was placed on the conveyor it was dropped, causing the paint cans to be damaged and paint to be spilled. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed inside a Hazmat tote to prevent further spillage and later placed inside a Hazmat Bag to be processed according to the Disposition.

DescribePack: Dent on paint can causing lid to open DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed upright according to directional arrows and placed inside a plastic bag as well as proper drum.

item.description:
Report X-2023120930

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-16
  • City: CHINO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package Handler accidentally dropped the box and caused bottle to break. Manager immediately had the package handlers working the area to clear out and vented out the area. Once area was completely vented out QA and Managers worked together to safely retrieve the box and place in vent and used absorbent to clean up rest of spill. DescribePack: top of glass bottle inside box broke completely causing the liquid to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Area was cleared out and vented out by opening trailer doors and using fans. Source of leak was placed inside a hazmat bag with absorbent and safely taken to vent.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately .5 gallons of hydroplate 1086 part A (UN1263) released from a 5 gallon plastic bucket due to a bad pallet that broke during transport. The release impacted trailer floor. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and it was determined that terminal personnel were capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. (1) 8 gallon poly drum was created as waste and left onsite for the terminal to manage.
